member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.Activity
member.summary: An activity resource contains information about an action that a particular channel, or user, has taken on YouTube. The actions reported in activity feeds include rating a video, sharing a video, marking a video as a favorite, commenting on a video, uploading a video, and so forth. Each activity resource identifies the type of action, the channel associated with the action, and the resource(s) associated with the action, such as the video that was rated or uploaded.

member.summary: The description of the resource primarily associated with the activity.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.ActivitySnippet.GroupId
member.summary: The group ID associated with the activity. A group ID identifies user events that are associated with the same user and resource. For example, if a user rates a video and marks the same video as a favorite, the entries for those events would have the same group ID in the user's activity feed. In your user interface, you can avoid repetition by grouping events with the same groupId value.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.Playlist
member.summary:
A playlist resource represents a YouTube playlist. A playlist is a collection of videos that can be viewed sequentially and shared with other users. A playlist can contain up to 200 videos, and YouTube does not limit the number of playlists that each user creates. By default, playlists are publicly visible to other users, but playlists can be public or private.
YouTube also uses playlists to identify special collections of videos for a channel, such as: - uploaded videos - favorite videos - positively rated (liked) videos - watch history - watch later To be more specific, these lists are associated with a channel, which is a collection of a person, group, or company's videos, playlists, and other YouTube information. You can retrieve the playlist IDs for each of these lists from the channel resource for a given channel.
You can then use the playlistItems.list method to retrieve any of those lists. You can also add or remove items from those lists by calling the playlistItems.insert and playlistItems.delete methods.

member.summary: The ID that YouTube uses to uniquely identify the playlist.

member.summary: The number of videos in the playlist.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.PlaylistItem
member.summary:
A playlistItem resource identifies another resource, such as a video, that is included in a playlist. In addition, the playlistItem resource contains details about the included resource that pertain specifically to how that resource is used in that playlist.
YouTube uses playlists to identify special collections of videos for a channel, such as: - uploaded videos - favorite videos - positively rated (liked) videos - watch history - watch later To be more specific, these lists are associated with a channel, which is a collection of a person, group, or company's videos, playlists, and other YouTube information.
You can retrieve the playlist IDs for each of these lists from the channel resource for a given channel. You can then use the playlistItems.list method to retrieve any of those lists. You can also add or remove items from those lists by calling the playlistItems.insert and playlistItems.delete methods. For example, if a user gives a positive rating to a video, you would insert that video into the liked videos playlist for that user's channel.

member.summary: Details about the content of a playlist item, such as the video or the video fragment start and end time included in the playlist.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.PlaylistItemContentDetails.EndAt
member.summary: The time, measured in seconds from the start of the video, when the video should stop playing. (The playlist owner can specify the times when the video should start and stop playing when the video is played in the context of the playlist.) By default, assume that the video.endTime is the end of the video.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.PlaylistItemContentDetails.StartAt
member.summary: The time, measured in seconds from the start of the video, when the video should start playing. (The playlist owner can specify the times when the video should start and stop playing when the video is played in the context of the playlist.) The default value is 0.

member.summary: Details about the media content of a YouTube video.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.VideoContentDetails.Duration
member.summary: The length of the video. The tag value is an ISO 8601 duration in the format PT#M#S, in which the letters PT indicate that the value specifies a period of time, and the letters M and S refer to length in minutes and seconds, respectively. The # characters preceding the M and S letters are both integers that specify the number of minutes (or seconds) of the video. For example, a value of PT15M51S indicates that the video is 15 minutes and 51 seconds long.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.VideoContentDetails.RegionRestriction
member.summary: The regionRestriction object contains information about the countries where a video is (or is not) viewable. The object will contain either the contentDetails.regionRestriction.allowed property or the contentDetails.regionRestriction.blocked property.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.VideoContentDetails.RegionRestrictionData
member.summary: The regionRestriction object contains information about the countries where a video is (or is not) viewable. The object will contain either the contentDetails.regionRestriction.allowed property or the contentDetails.regionRestriction.blocked property.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.VideoContentDetails.RegionRestrictionData.Allowed
member.summary: A list of region codes that identify countries where the video is viewable. If this property is present and a country is not listed in its value, then the video is blocked from appearing in that country. If this property is present and contains an empty list, the video is blocked in all countries.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.VideoContentDetails.RegionRestrictionData.Blocked
member.summary: A list of region codes that identify countries where the video is blocked. If this property is present and a country is not listed in its value, then the video is viewable in that country. If this property is present and contains an empty list, the video is viewable in all countries.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.ActivitiesResource.Insert(Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.Activity,System.String)
member.summary: Posts a bulletin for a specific channel. (The user submitting the request must be authorized to act on the channel's behalf.)
member.param:
Required - The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include.
The part names that you can include in the parameter value are snippet and contentDetails.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.ActivitiesResource.List(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of channel activity events that match the request criteria. For example, you can retrieve events associated with a particular channel, events associated with the user's subscriptions and Google+ friends, or the YouTube home page feed, which is customized for each user.
member.param:
Required - The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more activity resource properties that the API response will include. The part names that you can include in the parameter value are id, snippet, and contentDetails.
If the parameter identifies a property that contains child properties, the child properties will be included in the response. For example, in a activity resource, the snippet property contains other properties that identify the type of activity, a display title for the activity, and so forth. member.name: M:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.PlaylistItemsResource.Update(Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.PlaylistItem,System.String)
member.summary: Modifies a playlist item. For example, you could update the item's position in the playlist.
member.param:
Required - The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include.
The part names that you can include in the parameter value are snippet and contentDetails.
Note that this method will override the existing values for all of the mutable properties that are contained in any parts that the parameter value specifies. For example, a playlist item can specify a start time and end time, which identify the times portion of the video that should play when users watch the video in the playlist. If your request is updating a playlist item that sets these values, and the request's part parameter value includes the contentDetails part, the playlist item's start and end times will be updated to whatever value the request body specifies. If the request body does not specify values, the existing start and end times will be removed and replaced with the default settings.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.Order
member.summary: The order parameter specifies the method that will be used to order resources in the API response.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.Order.Date
member.summary: Resources are sorted in reverse chronological order based on the date they were created.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.Order.Rating
member.summary: Resources are sorted from highest to lowest rating.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.Order.Relevance
member.summary: Resources are sorted based on their relevance to the search query. This is the default value for this parameter.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.Order.ViewCount
member.summary: Resources are sorted from highest to lowest number of views.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoCaption
member.summary: The videoCaption parameter indicates whether the API should filter video search results based on whether they have captions.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoCaption.Any
member.summary: Do not filter results based on caption availability.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoCaption.ClosedCaption
member.summary: Only include videos that have captions.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoCaption.None
member.summary: Only include videos that do not have captions.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDefinition
member.summary: The videoDefinition parameter lets you restrict a search to only include either high definition (HD) or standard definition (SD) videos. HD videos are available for playback in at least 720p, though higher resolutions, like 1080p, might also be available.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDefinition.Any
member.summary: Return all videos, regardless of their resolution.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDefinition.High
member.summary: Only retrieve HD videos.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDefinition.Standard
member.summary: Only retrieve videos in standard definition.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDimension
member.summary: The videoDimension parameter lets you restrict a search to only retrieve 2D or 3D videos.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDimension.D
member.summary: Restrict search results to exclude 3D videos.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDimension.DValue
member.summary: Restrict search results to only include 3D videos.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDimension.Any
member.summary: Include both 3D and non-3D videos in returned results. This is the default value.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDuration
member.summary: The videoDuration parameter filters video search results based on their duration.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDuration.Any
member.summary: Do not filter video search results based on their duration. This is the default value.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDuration.Long
member.summary: Only include videos longer than 20 minutes.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDuration.Medium
member.summary: Only include videos that are between four and 20 minutes long (inclusive).

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoDuration.Short
member.summary: Only include videos that are less than four minutes long.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoEmbeddable
member.summary: The videoEmbeddable parameter lets you to restrict a search to only videos that can be embedded into a webpage.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoEmbeddable.True
member.summary: Only retrieve embeddable videos.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoLicense
member.summary: The videoLicense parameter filters search results to only include videos with a particular license. YouTube lets video uploaders choose to attach either the Creative Commons license or the standard YouTube license to each of their videos.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.VideoLicense.Youtube

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.Part
member.summary:
The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more search resource properties that the API response will include. The part names that you can include in the parameter value are id and snippet.
If the parameter identifies a property that contains child properties, the child properties will be included in the response. For example, in a search result, the snippet property contains other properties that identify the result's title, description, and so forth. If you set part=snippet, the API response will also contain all of those nested properties.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.PublishedAfter
member.summary: The publishedAfter parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources created after the specified time. The value is an RFC 3339 formatted date-time value (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.PublishedBefore
member.summary: The publishedBefore parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources created before the specified time. The value is an RFC 3339 formatted date-time value (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.Q
member.summary: The q parameter specifies the query term to search for.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.RelatedToVideoId
member.summary: The relatedToVideoId parameter retrieves a list of videos that are related to the video that the parameter value identifies. The parameter value must be set to a YouTube video ID and, if you are using this parameter, the type parameter must be set to video.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.TopicId
member.summary: The topicId parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources associated with the specified topic. The value identifies a Freebase topic ID.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.Type
member.summary: The type parameter restricts a search query to only retrieve a particular type of resource.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.VideoCaption
member.summary: The videoCaption parameter indicates whether the API should filter video search results based on whether they have captions.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.VideoCategoryId
member.summary: The videoCategoryId parameter filters video search results based on their category.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.VideoDefinition
member.summary: The videoDefinition parameter lets you restrict a search to only include either high definition (HD) or standard definition (SD) videos. HD videos are available for playback in at least 720p, though higher resolutions, like 1080p, might also be available.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.VideoDimension
member.summary: The videoDimension parameter lets you restrict a search to only retrieve 2D or 3D videos.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.VideoDuration
member.summary: The videoDuration parameter filters video search results based on their duration.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.VideoEmbeddable
member.summary: The videoEmbeddable parameter lets you to restrict a search to only videos that can be embedded into a webpage.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.VideoLicense
member.summary: The videoLicense parameter filters search results to only include videos with a particular license. YouTube lets video uploaders choose to attach either the Creative Commons license or the standard YouTube license to each of their videos.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.SearchResource.ListRequest.VideoSyndicated
member.summary: The videoSyndicated parameter lets you to restrict a search to only videos that can be played outside youtube.com.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.VideosResource.Insert(Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.Video,System.String)
member.summary: Uploads a video to YouTube and optionally sets the video's metadata.
member.param:
Required - The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include.
The part names that you can include in the parameter value are snippet, contentDetails, player, statistics, status, and topicDetails. However, not all of those parts contain properties that can be set when setting or updating a video's metadata. For example, the statistics object encapsulates statistics that YouTube calculates for a video and does not contain values that you can set or modify. If the parameter value specifies a part that does not contain mutable values, that part will still be included in the API response.

Required - The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more video resource properties that the API response will include. The part names that you can include in the parameter value are id, snippet, contentDetails, player, statistics, status, and topicDetails.
If the parameter identifies a property that contains child properties, the child properties will be included in the response. For example, in a video resource, the snippet property contains the channelId, title, description, tags, and categoryId properties. As such, if you set part=snippet, the API response will contain all of those properties.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.VideosResource.Update(Google.Apis.Youtube.v3.Data.Video,System.String)
member.summary: Updates a video's metadata.
member.param:
Required - The part parameter serves two purposes in this operation. It identifies the properties that the write operation will set as well as the properties that the API response will include.
The part names that you can include in the parameter value are snippet, contentDetails, player, statistics, status, and topicDetails.
Note that this method will override the existing values for all of the mutable properties that are contained in any parts that the parameter value specifies. For example, a video's privacy setting is contained in the status part. As such, if your request is updating a private video, and the request's part parameter value includes the status part, the video's privacy setting will be updated to whatever value the request body specifies. If the request body does not specify a value, the existing privacy setting will be removed and the video will revert to the default privacy setting.
In addition, not all of those parts contain properties that can be set when setting or updating a video's metadata. For example, the statistics object encapsulates statistics that YouTube calculates for a video and does not contain values that you can set or modify. If the parameter value specifies a part that does not contain mutable values, that part will still be included in the API response.
